burlap.mdp.singleagent.common

Class VisualActionObserver

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • burlap.mdp.singleagent.common.VisualActionObserver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EnvironmentObserver, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class VisualActionObserver
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements EnvironmentObserver
    This class enables the live rendering of action calls or environment interactions, by implementing the EnvironmentObserver interface. It updates the visualizer to show the resulting state of an action call. After rendering, the client thread is blocked for a specified interval of time to allow the state to be observed (by default the value is set to 17ms, which is about 60FPS). This class will also render the new state of an Environment after a Environment.resetEnvironment() message is observed and block for the same interval of time. This class is especially useful for watching learning algorithms or Monte Carlo-like planning algorithms in action.

    Optionally, this class may also render state-action events in an Environment (so that the action is also rendered) so long as the input Visualizer has a set StateActionRenderLayer. To enable this support, pass the setRepaintOnActionInitiation(boolean) true. If you would then like to disable rendering the post-state from the observeEnvironmentInteraction(burlap.mdp.singleagent.environment.EnvironmentOutcome) method, pass the setRepaintStateOnEnvironmentInteraction(boolean) false.

    Author:
    James MacGlashan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • cHeight

        The height of the painter

      • actionRenderDelay

        protected long actionRenderDelay
        How long to wait in ms for a state to be rendered before returning control to the agent. Default is 17ms (about 60fps)

      • repaintStateOnEnvironmentInteraction

        protected boolean repaintStateOnEnvironmentInteraction
        If true (which is default), then the post-state in an observeEnvironmentInteraction(burlap.mdp.singleagent.environment.EnvironmentOutcome) is rendered.

      • repaintOnActionInitiation

        protected boolean repaintOnActionInitiation
        If true, then a a state-action pair is rendered on calls to observeEnvironmentActionInitiation(State, Action) so long as the input Visualizer has a set StateActionRenderLayer. Default value is false.

      • setFrameDelay

        public void setFrameDelay(long delay)
        Sets how long to wait in ms for a state to be rendered before returning control the agent. The default value is 17, which is about 60FPS.

      • getPainter

        public Visualizer getPainter()

      • setPainter

        public void setPainter(Visualizer painter)

      • setRepaintStateOnEnvironmentInteraction

        public void setRepaintStateOnEnvironmentInteraction(boolean repaintStateOnEnvironmentInteraction)
        Sets whether the state should be updated on environment interactions events (the observeEnvironmentInteraction(burlap.mdp.singleagent.environment.EnvironmentOutcome) or only with state-actions in the observeEnvironmentActionInitiation(State, Action).
        Parameters:
        repaintStateOnEnvironmentInteraction - if true, then update states with environment interactions; if false then only with environment action initiation.

      • setRepaintOnActionInitiation

        public void setRepaintOnActionInitiation(boolean repaintOnActionInitiation)
        Sets whether the state-action should be updated when an action is initiated in an Environment via the observeEnvironmentActionInitiation(State, Action) method.
        Parameters:
        repaintOnActionInitiation - if true, then state-action's are painted on action initiation; if false, they are not.

        Initializes the visual explorer GUI and presents it to the user.

        Parameters:
